<The North American Aviation T-6 Texan
World War II and into the 1970s
2:
--------------------
Text: North American T-6 Texan:  The United States Army Air Corps (USAAC) and USAAF designated it as the AT-6, the United States Navy the SNJ, and British Commonwealth air forces the Harvard, the name by which it is best known outside of the US.
Triplets:<North American
3:
--------------------
Text: North American T-6 Texan:  Starting in 1948, the new United States Air Force (USAF) designated it the T-6, with the USN following in 1962.
Triplets:<North American T-6 Texan
4:
--------------------
Text: North American T-6 Texan:  It remains a popular warbird aircraft used for airshow demonstrations and static displays.
